column4: ack! i b0rked my system by upgrading to the intrepid version of libselinux1
is there any way to use the livecd to reinstall the proper version?
i upgraded a single package using dpkg -i (which i assumed would warn me about deps)
the package needs to have those dependencies setup for that to happen.  They usually aren't for cross repo systems...
i just downloaded libselinux1-vv.deb and ran sudo dpkg -i
it's not really a cross repo system
for a little background, and because i've got plenty of time if i have to reinstall
I think you can use the livecd, mount your root system, chroot into that mount point, and then install the correct package
i was trying to upgrade vim to the intrepid version
Aha! thanks, that's a great point.
on a different note, 8.04.1 livecd is beautiful
thanks, I think that worked swimmingly, although i got a weird error about not being able to create /dev/null (!!)  i'll be back after reboot to let you know if it worked and thank you profusely
thanks a whole ton everything is back to normal. i can't believe i didn't think of chroot... it's actually a utility i've very rarely used
the directions are actually classic for fixing a broken alpha testing system.  If one upgrade breaks it, you use that strat to update till a fix comes through
i'm only asking because you seem like you might know: is there an IRC channel for awesomeWM or tiling WMs in general?
heh, I only know a few random things, and thats not one of them  : )   sorry
